intro: Luziola leiocarpa, commonly known as the white-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. It has slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Luziola leiocarpa is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
